title.value: Periodic agent-state based Q-learning for POMDPs
title.justification: The title is directly stated at the beginning of the paper and aligns with the main content, focusing on the proposed PASQL method for POMDPs.
title.quote: Periodic agent-state based Q-learning for POMDPs

extractions.description: This paper introduces the PASQL (periodic agent-state based Q-learning) algorithm, which is a variant of Q-learning tailored for Partially Observable Markov Decision Processes (POMDPs). It aims to leverage non-stationary policies to outperform traditional stationary policies by using periodicity in agent states. The paper includes theoretical analysis proving the convergence of PASQL and numerical experiments demonstrating its advantages over stationary policy algorithms like ASQL.

type.justification: The paper includes numerical experiments demonstrating the effectiveness of the proposed PASQL algorithm compared to stationary policy algorithms.
type.quote: Finally, we present a numerical experiment to highlight the salient features of PASQL and demonstrate the benefit of learning periodic policies over stationary policies.

name.justification: The research primarily focuses on improving Q-learning algorithms for partially observable environments, which is a key area within Reinforcement Learning.
name.quote: We propose PASQL (periodic agent-state based Q-learning), which is a variant of agent-state-based Q-learning that learns periodic policies.

name.justification: The research enhances Q-learning within the context of POMDPs, which is explicitly mentioned throughout the paper.
name.quote: The standard approach for Partially Observable Markov Decision Processes (POMDPs) is to convert them to a fully observed belief-state MDP.

name.justification: PASQL is the primary model proposed by the authors for improving agent-state based Q-learning in POMDPs.
name.quote: To leverage this feature, we propose PASQL (periodic agent-state based Q-learning), which is a variant of agent-state-based Q-learning that learns periodic policies.

is_contributed.justification: PASQL is introduced as a novel approach contributing to the field of reinforcement learning with a focus on POMDPs.
is_contributed.quote: Motivated by the fact that non-stationary agent-state based policies outperform stationary ones, we propose a variant of agent-state based Q-learning (ASQL) that learns periodic policies. We call this algorithm periodic agent-state based Q-learning (PASQL).

is_executed.justification: There is no specific mention in the text of execution environments like GPU or CPU for PASQL.
is_executed.quote: Finally, we present a numerical experiment to highlight the salient features of PASQL and demonstrate the benefit of learning periodic policies over stationary policies.

is_compared.justification: PASQL is compared numerically with ASQL in terms of its performance in learning policies for POMDPs.
is_compared.quote: Finally, we present a numerical experiment to highlight the salient features of PASQL and demonstrate the benefit of learning periodic policies over stationary policies.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no explicit reference to another paper for PASQL since it is the main contribution of this paper.
